text:
e="preserve">Liam Reilly (29 January 1955 – 1 January 2021) was an Irish pop rock singer-songwriter and keyboardist. He was a member of the group Bagatelle. He was born in Dundalk, Ireland. He participated in the 1990 Eurovision Song Contest with his single "Somewhere in Europe". He also wrote the 1991 Eurovision Irish submission "Could It Be That I'm in Love".
Reilly died suddenly at his home in Dundalk on 1 January 2021 at the age of 65.

annotations.surface_form: Could It Be That I'm in Love
